text: France was represented by Annick Thoumazeau, with the song '"Autant d'amoureux que d'étoiles", at the 1984 Eurovision Song Contest, which took place on 5 May in Luxembourg City. The song was chosen through a national final organised by broadcaster Antenne 2. ==Before Eurovision== === National final === The national final was held on 25 March, hosted by Jean-Pierre Foucault and Catherine Ceylac. Fourteen songs took part with the winner chosen by a panel of TV viewers who were telephoned and asked to vote on the songs.ESC National Finals database 1984 {| class="sortable wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto; text-align:center" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! Place |- |1 | align="left" |Victoire | align="left" |"On n'est pas rock, on n'est pas jazz" |66 |6 |- | 2 | align="left" |Muriel Laude | align="left" |"Comme un automate" | 16 |13 |- |3 | align="left" |Christine Carrasco | align="left" |"Le temps de la musique" |179 |2 |- |4 | align="left" |Pierre Azama | align="left" |"Les années claires" |48 |8 |- |5 | align="left" |Jean- Claude Allora | align="left" |"Le cœur dans les nuages" |61 |7 |- |6 | align="left" |Émilien | align="left" |"Et je l'aimais" |144 |3 |- |7 | align="left" |Euréka | align="left" |"Fais-le, prends le temps de vivre" |24 |12 |- |8 | align="left" |Elia | align="left" |"Eh musicien" |29 |10 |- |9 | align="left" |Evelyne Sélès | align="left" |"Quand la terre était un jardin" |45 |9 |- |10 | align="left" |J.C.B. | align="left" |"Parler d'amour" |16 |13 |- |11 | align="left" |Arc-en-Ciel | align="left" |"Ton étoile" |121 |5 |- |12 | align="left" |Marise Bonnet | align="left" |"Y-a-t-il un rêve" |26 |11 |- style="font-weight:bold; background:gold;" |13 | align="left" |Annick Thoumazeau | align="left" |"Autant d'amoureux que d'étoiles" |206 |1 |- |14 | align="left" |Laurence Saltiel | align="left" |"Le retour des bergers" |132 |4 |} == At Eurovision == On the night of the final Thoumazeau performed third in the running order, following Luxembourg and preceding Spain. At the close of voting "Autant d'amoureux que d'étoiles" had received 61 points (including a maximum 12 from the Netherlands), placing France 8th of the 19 entries. The French jury awarded its 12 points to Belgium.ESC History - France 1984 ==See also== *France in the Eurovision Song Contest *Eurovision Song Contest 1984 == References == Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1984 Category:France in the Eurovision Song Contest Category:1984 in French music
